question: What does ANI stand for?
answers: Artificial Narrow Intelligence
Artificial Niche Intelligence
Advanced Neural Intelligence
Automated Network Intelligence
correct: Artificial Narrow Intelligence

question: What is the correct relationship between AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning?
answers: ML > AI > DL
DL > ML > AI
AI > ML > DL
AI > DL > ML
correct: AI > ML > DL

question: Which type of AI is currently available and in use today?
answers: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI)
Artificial Super Intelligence (ASI)
Artificial Narrow Intelligence (ANI)
Artificial Limited Intelligence (ALI)
correct: Artificial Narrow Intelligence (ANI)

question: What is the main difference between traditional software and AI/ML software?
answers: Traditional software uses predefined heuristics, while AI/ML relies on manually tuned parameters rather than data
Traditional software uses explicit rules, AI/ML learns patterns from data
There is no significant difference between the two
Traditional software is always faster and more efficient than AI/ML
correct: Traditional software uses explicit rules, AI/ML learns patterns from data

question: In machine learning, what is an algorithm?
answers: The final trained system that makes predictions
A set of rules or instructions for solving a problem
The data used for training
The output of the system
correct: A set of rules or instructions for solving a problem

question: What is a model in machine learning?
answers: The recipe or instructions
The raw data before processing
The result of training - the learned patterns
The software library used (e.g., TensorFlow)
correct: The result of training - the learned patterns

question: What does 'deep' refer to in Deep Learning?
answers: The depth and complexity of data analysis performed
Multiple layers of processing in neural networks
The extreme complexity of the problem being solved
The amount of data used
correct: Multiple layers of processing in neural networks

question: What is the training phase in AI systems?
answers: When the AI applies learned patterns to completely new and unseen situations
When the AI system learns patterns from large amounts of data
When users interact with the AI
When the AI is being tested
correct: When the AI system learns patterns from large amounts of data

question: What is the inference phase in AI systems?
answers: When the AI is learning from data
When the AI is being initially developed and programmed by engineers
When trained AI applies what it learned to new situations
When the AI is initialized but not yet trained
correct: When trained AI applies what it learned to new situations

question: What type of AI focuses on creating new content rather than just analyzing existing data?
answers: Predictive AI
Discriminative AI
Generative AI
Analytical AI
correct: Generative AI

question: Which of the following is an example of Generative AI?
answers: Spam filters
Credit scoring systems
ChatGPT
Fraud detection
correct: ChatGPT

question: What does NLP stand for in AI?
answers: Natural Language Programming
Natural Language Processing
Network Layer Protection
Non-Linear Programming
correct: Natural Language Processing

question: What is a Large Language Model (LLM)?
answers: A small, highly efficient and optimized text processing system
A model with billions/trillions of parameters trained on vast text data
A traditional rule-based system with extensive documentation
A model with hundreds of millions of parameters designed for specialized language tasks
correct: A model with billions/trillions of parameters trained on vast text data

question: What is the 'context window' in AI systems?
answers: The graphical user interface for interacting with the model
Maximum amount of text the model can 'see' at once
The specific time period allocated for training the model
The time window from the most recent messages that the model prioritizes
correct: Maximum amount of text the model can 'see' at once

question: What is a knowledge cutoff in AI models?
answers: The last time the model was prompted by a user
The most recent point when the AI's training data was updated
The maximum processing speed the system can achieve over time
The minimum amount of data required for proper functioning of the model
correct: The most recent point when the AI's training data was updated

question: What does 'GIGO' mean in the context of AI and data?
answers: Good Input, Good Output
General Intelligence Goes Online
Garbage In, Garbage Out
Generated Input, Generated Output
correct: Garbage In, Garbage Out

question: What type of machine learning uses labeled examples to learn?
answers: Unsupervised Learning
Supervised Learning
Reinforcement Learning
Transfer Learning
correct: Supervised Learning

question: What type of machine learning learns through trial and error with rewards?
answers: Supervised Learning
Unsupervised Learning
Reinforcement Learning
Deep Learning
correct: Reinforcement Learning

question: What is multimodal AI?
answers: AI that only processes text
AI that combines multiple types of input like text, images, and audio
AI that runs on multiple distributed computer systems, in a systematized manner
AI that processes output in multiple languages
correct: AI that combines multiple types of input like text, images, and audio

question: What is a token in the context of LLMs?
answers: A security credential
A unit of text (usually about 0.75 words)
A type of cryptocurrency
An entire word regardless of length
correct: A unit of text (usually about 0.75 words)

question: Why is data quality important for AI systems?
answers: It makes the system run significantly faster and more efficiently
AI systems are only as good as the data they're trained on
It reduces hardware costs
It's secondary because models learn to correct mistakes automatically
correct: AI systems are only as good as the data they're trained on

question: What can happen when AI is trained on biased data?
answers: It may achieve high overall accuracy but perform poorly on underrepresented groups
It may appear accurate in validation but fail in real-world deployments due to dataset shift
The AI can amplify and perpetuate those biases
It may overfit to majority patterns, increasing false negatives for minority groups
correct: The AI can amplify and perpetuate those biases

question: What is a 'hallucination' in the context of AI?
answers: When AI processes and interprets visual images incorrectly
When the model generates plausible but false information
When the system crashes unexpectedly during operation
When the model cites sources it never accessed but is still considered correct
correct: When the model generates plausible but false information

question: What type of AI is best for classifying emails as spam or not spam?
answers: Generative AI
Creative AI
Predictive/Discriminative AI
Generative AI fine-tuned for text generation only
correct: Predictive/Discriminative AI

question: What is Computer Vision in AI?
answers: AI focused on identifying objects and scenes in images and video
AI that can recognize and generate visual content
A technology for rendering graphics and 3D scenes
AI that enhances image quality but does not interpret content
correct: AI that can recognize and generate visual content

question: Which statement best describes AGI (Artificial General Intelligence)?
answers: It's currently available and widely deployed in modern smartphones and devices
Human-level intelligence across all domains that doesn't yet exist
It only works for games
It's available in research labs but not yet in consumer products
correct: Human-level intelligence across all domains that doesn't yet exist

question: What makes Deep Learning different from traditional Machine Learning?
answers: It uses significantly less data to achieve better results
It uses artificial neural networks with multiple layers
It's always faster and more efficient in all applications
It trains only the last layer while earlier layers stay fixed
correct: It uses artificial neural networks with multiple layers

question: When using AI, why is it important to know about the context window limitation?
answers: It affects the screen resolution
Longer documents may need splitting and earlier conversation parts may be 'forgotten'
It determines the AI's speed and computational efficiency while processing input data
It determines how many images a model can store permanently
correct: Longer documents may need splitting and earlier conversation parts may be 'forgotten'
